Composestar.Runtime.FLIRT.message
Class MessageInfo

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Composestar.Runtime.FLIRT.message.MessageInfo
public class MessageInfo
extends java.lang.Object

 This file is part of Composestar project [http://composestar.sf.net].
 Copyright (C) 2003 University of Twente.
 Licensed under LGPL v2.1 or (at your option) any later version.
 [http://www.fsf.org/copyleft/lgpl.html]
 $Id$
MessageInfo is a singleton object that provides an interface to acess reflective information about the reified message being filtered. Through this object programmers can refer to various parts of the refied message, such the sender, receiver or arguments of a message. The MessageInfo object is intended to be used within a method that is subject to interception or a method that is part of the implementation of Compose* concern. In other cases, e.g. in ordinary methods that are not intercepted, the MessageInfo instance does not provide correct information.

Each getter method returns an intance of Object. Therefore, it may be neccessary to cast this instance to its direct type. The following piece of code shows a simple example of the use of MessageInfo: 


   ...
   void foo(){
      Bar sender=null;

      MessageInfo mInfo = Composestar.Runtime.FLIRT.message.MessageInfo.getIntance();

      if (mInfo.getSender() instanceof Bar)
         sender=(Bar)mInfo.getSender();
		...
      
   }
